page.title: 15Wytham's Village Shop
page.content: The Post-master and his wife, in the village stores, meet all the people in Wytham. His sister-in-law keeps a scrap book of local events. They gave a first-hand picture of everyday life. No great changes have taken place in the last four years. The bus comes once a week; the post is delivered and collected once a day; newspapers are brought from Wolvercote; the village shop provides local needs; most people have cars and the local children travel to Botley to school. The flats in Wytham Abbey have fewer residents now, but visitors to the village have increased. Woodland animals forage in the gardens, and the river floods the fields in winter. The children love the summer fete and the Christmas carol-singing. The oldest inhabitant, we were told, is aged 90, and the youngest is aged 6 months.
